search_range_x.description: Horizontal search range to be used. The number of horizontal search locations is 2*search_range_x + 1. Search range is restricted to 2 options only: +/-12 x +/-8 or +/-8 x +/-6.
search_range_x.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant: no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

search_range_y.description: Vertical search range to be used. The number of vertical search locations is 2*search_range_y + 1. Search range is restricted to 2 options only: +/-12 x +/-8 or +/-8 x +/-6.
search_range_y.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant: no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

sub_pel_search_enable.description: Whether sub-pixel ME (Optical Flow) is enabled.
sub_pel_search_enable.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant: no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

transform_model.description: Defines which transform model to use during transform estimation stage (0=projective, 1=affine, 2=rigid, 3=rigid with post-processing).
transform_model.additional_notes: Constant: no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

search_range_override.description: Defines the strategy of determining the search_range: . 0 = Flow decisions may override chromatix value. 1 = Chromatix value is used irrespective of flow decisions.
search_range_override.additional_notes: Hide in GUI ! Constant: no dynamic configuration even when control variable change.

max_allowed_sad.description: Maximum allowed SAD. If SAD exceeds this threshold the block will be marked invalid (probably ME problem due to occlusion, too fast motion, etc).

min_allowed_tar_mad.description: Minimum allowed tarMAD value. If below this value (non-informative block) â€“ the block will be marked invalid.

meaningful_sad_diff.description: Locations with regular SAD difference below this threshold are considered to have exactly the same similarity measure (even if normalized SAD difference is big).

min_sad_diff_denom.description: Determines the lower limit of denominator used in normalized difference of SAD calculation to avoid overflow.

robustness_measure_dist_map_tab.description: Provides a requirement on minimal normalized difference of SADs at distance 1-9 pixels (for big distances the expected differences should be big). Default values: 0, 128, 128, 128, 128, 128, 128, 128 (no penalty to single pixel distance; afterwards same penalty for all other distances) .

enable_transform_confidence.description: Whether to calculate and apply transform confidence (based on coverage of the frame by LRME-calculated valid MVs). Frames with higher coverage get higher confidence.

transform_confidence_mapping_base.description: Defines mapping function from calculated transform confidence to actually used transform confidence. The calculated confidence is in the range 0:256 (8 bit fraction). The mapping is: actual confidence = transform_confidence_mapping_base when calculated confidence is less or equal than transform_confidence_mapping_c1; 256 when calculated confidence is greater than transform_confidence_mapping_c2 and linear interpolation in-between.

transform_confidence_mapping_c1.description: Defines mapping function from calculated transform confidence to actually used transform confidence. The calculated confidence is in the range 0:256 (8 bit fraction). The mapping is: actual confidence = transform_confidence_mapping_base when calculated confidence is less or equal than transform_confidence_mapping_c1; 256 when calculated confidence is greater than transform_confidence_mapping_c2 and linear interpolation in-between.

transform_confidence_mapping_c2.description: Defines mapping function from calculated transform confidence to actually used transform confidence. The calculated confidence is in the range 0:256 (8 bit fraction). The mapping is: actual confidence = transform_confidence_mapping_base when calculated confidence is less or equal than transform_confidence_mapping_c1; 256 when calculated confidence is greater than transform_confidence_mapping_c2 and linear interpolation in-between.

transform_confidence_thr_to_force_identi.description: When calculated transform confidence (before mapping) is below this threshold, the transform is ignored and replaced by identity transform. Hysteresis is used on this parameter to avoid excessive switching.
